info.title: LabApiGateway
info.description: The entrypoint for all services created by the data science team.

get.summary: Gives indexing status for nodes in search
get.description: Retrieves the indexing status of nodes by node_id in search.

post.description: Retrieves results for a particular search query in a space and/or org
Retrieves search results for a given query and summarizes the results in the context of the question.

get.summary: Get content processing status for concept track
get.description: Retrieves processing status for content submitted to concept track.
Retrieves node suggestions for a given file ID.

get.summary: Get details suggested nodes in concept track
get.description: Retrieves node details for a given node suggested from a piece of content.

get.summary: Get models used in concept track
get.description: Retrieves the uuids and names of different concept track models being used.

get.summary: Get detailed concept track info for video
get.description: Retrieves details about the concepts found in a given video file.

post.description: This API receives the text location and send it to concept tracks processing SQS, it returns a request_uuid which can be used to query the status and results

get.summary: Check the status of one or more requests
get.description: This API accepts a query parameter `request_ids` the value of it is one request or multiple requests separated by a comma ','

parameters.name: request_ids
parameters.description: A single request UUID or multiple UUIDs separated by commas (e.g., 'uuid1' or 'uuid1,uuid2,uuid3')

get.summary: Retrieve node suggestions for a request
get.description: Fetches a list of nodes generated from the text associated with the specified request ID. Each node represents a concept or entity identified in the text, including its title, unique ID, and metadata about its position in the original text.

parameters.name: request_id
parameters.description: The UUID received from the initial text submission. This identifies the request for which node suggestions are being retrieved.

200.description: Successful response with a list of node suggestions generated from the analyzed text.

404.description: Not found - No nodes exist for the specified request ID

get.summary: Retrieve node details for a request and a node
get.description: Fetches the details of a node specified by request_id and node_id

parameters.name: request_id
parameters.description: The UUID received from the initial text submission. This identifies the request for which node suggestions are being retrieved.

parameters.name: node_id
parameters.description: The UUID received from nodes suggestion. This identifies the node for which node details are being retrieved.

200.description: Successful response with details of the node.

404.description: Not found - No nodes exist for the specified request ID

get.summary: Get space enrichment suggestions from DCS
get.description: Retrieves ordered list of nodes suitable for incorporation into a space from the DCS.

get.summary: Get DCS indexing status for node
get.description: Retrieves indexing status in DCS for a given batch of node ids.
Retrieves processing status of a file in pdf-2-text.

post.summary: Check the status of multiple PDF to text conversion jobs
post.description: This endpoint allows you to check the status of multiple file conversion jobs by providing their file IDs.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the status of the files

post.description: Retrieves suggested questions for a given node of content.

explanations: Darwin uncovered the theory of evolution.
Einstein discovered relativity, both special and general.

questions: How should the corpus be constructed?
What data is used to build the corpus?
answers: A corpus is a collection of linguistic data.
It should be constructed so as to be balanced and representative.
Linguistic data which was not originally produced for the process of linguistic analysis.

post.summary: Endpoint for grading open text answers to questions
post.description: Grades student answers against a model answer to give a score and an explanation of the score.

value.explanation: Student got the answer pretty wrong.

post.summary: Endpoint for getting data on recent searches by users
post.description: Returns detailed data on user searches in a space over time.

200.description: A map of search analytics data keyed by UUID

post.description: Returns detailed data on user searches in a space over time.

200.description: A map of search analytics data keyed by UUID

get.description: Returns summary of the content in a node.

post.description: Returns packet by packet response from RAG search.

requestBody.description: Streaming search summarizer lambda function URL

post.description: Endpoint to get suggestions for the next nodes based on the current state.

post.summary: Contextulise or re-contextualise documents in a space.
post.description: Endpoint contextualise or re-contextualise documents in a space.

documents.doc_1: The Sun is the star at the center of the Solar System. It is a nearly perfect sphere of hot plasma,[18][19] heated to incandescence by nuclear fusion reactions in its core, radiating the energy mainly as visible light, ultraviolet light, and infrared radiation. It is by far the most important source of energy for life on Earth. Its diameter is about 1.39 million kilometres (864,000 miles), or 109 times that of Earth. Its mass is about 330,000 times that of Earth; it accounts for about 99.86% of the total mass of the Solar System.[20] Roughly three quarters of the Sun's mass consists of hydrogen (~73%); the rest is mostly helium (~25%), with much smaller quantities of heavier elements, including oxygen, carbon, neon and iron.[21]
documents.doc_2: The dog or domestic dog (Canis familiaris or Canis lupus familiaris)[4] is a domesticated descendant of the wolf, characterized by an upturning tail. The dog derived from an ancient, extinct wolf,[5][6] and the modern grey wolf is the dog's nearest living relative.[7] The dog was the first species to be domesticated,[8][7] by hunterâ€“gatherers over 15,000 years ago,[6] before the development of agriculture.[1] Their long association with humans has led dogs to be uniquely adapted to human behavior,[9] leading to a large number of domestic individuals[10] and the ability to thrive on a starch-rich diet that would be inadequate for other canids.[11]
documents.doc_3: A car (or automobile) is a wheeled motor vehicle used for transportation. Most definitions of cars say that they run primarily on roads, seat one-to-eight people, have four wheels and mainly transport people rather than goods.[2][3] Cars came into global use during the 20th century, and developed economies depend on them. The year 1886 is regarded as the birth year of the car when German inventor Karl Benz patented his Benz Patent-Motorwagen.[1][4][5] Cars became widely available in the early 20th century. One of the first cars accessible to the masses was the 1908 Model T, an American car manufactured by the Ford Motor Company. Cars were rapidly adopted in the US, where they replaced animal-drawn carriages and carts.[6] In Europe and other parts of the world, demand for automobiles did not increase until after World War II.[6]

post.summary: Position documents in a contextualised space .
post.description: Endpoint to position documents in a space without altering the existing contextualisation.

documents.doc_4: The Sun's core fuses about 600 million tons of hydrogen into helium every second, converting 4 million tons of matter into energy every second as a result. This energy, which can take between 10,000 and 170,000 years to escape the core, is the source of the Sun's light and heat. When hydrogen fusion in its core has diminished to the point at which the Sun is no longer in hydrostatic equilibrium, its core will undergo a marked increase in density and temperature while its outer layers expand, eventually transforming the Sun into a red giant. It is calculated that the Sun will become sufficiently large to engulf the current orbits of Mercury and Venus, and render Earth uninhabitable â€“ but not for about five billion years. After this, it will shed its outer layers and become a dense type of cooling star known as a white dwarf, and no longer produce energy by fusion, but still glow and give off heat from its previous fusion.
documents.doc_5: In 1999, a study of mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) indicated that the domestic dog may have originated from the grey wolf, with the dingo and New Guinea singing dog breeds having developed at a time when human communities were more isolated from each other.[15] In the third edition of Mammal Species of the World published in 2005, the mammalogist W. Christopher Wozencraft listed under the wolf Canis lupus its wild subspecies and proposed two additional subspecies which formed the domestic dog clade: familiaris as named by Linneaus in 1758 and dingo named by Meyer in 1793. Wozencraft included hallstromi (the New Guinea singing dog) as another name (junior synonym) for the dingo. Wozencraft referred to the mtDNA study as one of the guides informing his decision.[3] Mammalogists have debated the inclusion of familiaris and dingo together under the domestic dog clade.[16][17]
documents.doc_6: These include rear-reversing cameras, air conditioning, navigation systems, and in-car entertainment. Most cars in use in the early 2020s are propelled by an internal combustion engine, fueled by the combustion of fossil fuels. Electric cars, which were invented early in the history of the car, became commercially available in the 2000s and are predicted to cost less to buy than gasoline cars before 2025.[7][8] The transition from fossil fuels to electric cars features prominently in most climate change mitigation scenarios,[9] such as Project Drawdown's 100 actionable solutions for climate change.[10

n_topics.description: The desired number of topics to extract.

n_keywords.description: The number of keywords per topic to retrieve.

topic_priors.description: A list of topic prior keywords, where each element is an array of strings representing related terms.

documents_url.description: Presigned s3 url containing all nodes textual data.

total_score.description: Overall quality score for the contextualisation

component_scores.description: Breakdown of individual component quality scores

topic_scores.description: Individual quality scores for each topic

edge_scores.description: Scores for relationships between topic pairs

recommendations.description: List of recommendations for improving topic quality

topic_keywords.description: Mapping of topic IDs to their keywords

num_documents.description: Total number of documents in the analysis

num_topics.description: Total number of topics in the model

document_topic_distribution.description: Mapping of document IDs to their topic distributions.

topic_keywords.description: Mapping of topic IDs to lists of associated keywords.

documents.description: A mapping from document identifiers to their textual content.

example.node_text: This is the detailed text of the node.

nodes.description: A list of nodes identified in the analyzed text. Each node includes a title, unique ID, and metadata.

title.description: The name or label of the concept or entity identified in the text.

id.description: A unique identifier for the node, in UUID format.

metadata.description: Additional information about the node's position in the original text.

start.description: The starting character position of the node in the original text (0-based index).

end.description: The ending character position of the node in the original text (inclusive).

node_title.description: The name or label of the concept or entity identified in the text.

node_text.description: The text associated with the node

start.description: The index of the first paragraph in the node

end.description: The index of the last parageaph of the node

keywords.description: List of keywords generated from the node text

example.text: The North East Line is a high-capacity Mass Rapid Transit (MRT) line in Singapore. Operated by SBS Transit, the 20-kilometre (12 mi) line runs from HarbourFront station in southern Singapore to Punggol station in the northeast via Chinatown, Little India, Serangoon and Hougang. Completed at a cost of S$5 billion, the line began operating 14 of its 16 stations on 20 June 2003.

The North East Line is a high-capacity Mass Rapid Transit (MRT) line in Singapore. Operated by SBS Transit, the 20-kilometre (12 mi) line runs from HarbourFront station in southern Singapore to Punggol station in the northeast via Chinatown, Little India, Serangoon and Hougang. Completed at a cost of S$5 billion, the line began operating 14 of its 16 stations on 20 June 2003.

answers: A corpus is a collection of linguistic data.
It should be constructed so as to be balanced and representative.

explanations: Darwin uncovered the theory of evolution.
Einstein discovered relativity, both special and general.

example.question: What is a cryptocurrency?
example.student_answer: Cryptocurrency is a physical coin minted by governments, based on the gold standard, which needs a centralized bank for all transactions and validations.
example.model_answer: Cryptocurrency is a digital or virtual currency that uses cryptography for security and operates on a decentralized platform, typically based on blockchain technology.

example.explanation: Student got the answer roughly right.

example.summary:
The document discusses the composition of the Sun. Key points:

1. The Sun is composed primarily of hydrogen (74.9%) and helium (23.8%). Heavier elements ("metals") make up less than 2%.

2. The hydrogen and helium were produced in the first 20 minutes after the Big Bang. Heavier elements were produced by previous generations of stars and spread through supernovae explosions.

3. Originally the Sun had 71.1% hydrogen, 27.4% helium, 1.5% heavier elements. Gravity caused heavier elements to settle towards the core over time.

4. In the core, hydrogen fused into helium over billions of years. The core now has ~60% helium. An inner helium core is starting to form.

5. In 5 billion years helium buildup will cause the Sun to become a red giant when it exits the main sequence.

6. The composition of the Sun's photosphere is considered representative of the primordial solar system composition. It's measured by spectroscopy of the photosphere and meteorites.

specificity_ordering.description: Ordering of concepts based on specificity.

space_node_details.description: Details of nodes in the space.

node_id.description: Unique identifier for the current node.

specificity.description: Specificity scores for the current node.

correctness_map.description: Map of answer IDs to correctness (0 or 1).
